poem:
Title: "Reflections on a Screened Age"

Screened souls flit, flicker eternally
neither here nor there,
in the non-places of silicon prophecy.
Connected, we divide, ourselves from the earth;
our bodies, mere caricature.
Sacred becomes the jest of byte-sized truths
And our gods speak in tidy Tweets.
What of the moor, the solitary hawk's cry?
The stillness unbroken but by breath
in the ebon mirrored night.
